result.execSummary:
The defendant Haley Amber Revoy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Submit to AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations.

Submit to AODA assessment and comply with any recommendations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Haley Amber Revoy

records.addlTxt:
10:01 AM Defendant Haley Amber Revoy appeared in court. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.   Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  DE enters plea of GUILTY to all counts. court adjourns until after initiaql appearances when court will proceed with the plea. Back on record at 11:07 AM appearances are as previously stated. Court questions defendant on plea. Defendant states it is still her intention to proceed with a GUILTY plea. Court questions defendant on counsel. Defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives the right to an Attorney. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC. Comments by parties.
Court Imposes:
Ct. 1 
Withheld Sentence- 1 Yr. Probation 
Conditions: 
$243 Court Costs 
$200 DNA + Sample 
AODA Assessment and any recommended follow through 

Ct. 2- 
Withheld Sentence- 1 Yr. Probation 
Conditions: 
$243 Court Costs 
$200 DNA + Sample
AODA Assessment and any recommended follow through  


Appeal Rights Given
